Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (59.26%) toMagainin 2K: 23%; A: 15%; G: 12%.  GRAVY: -0.138; M Wt: 2816.455; Mol formula: C129H215N35O31S2; molar extinction coeff: 0.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 64 ug/ml), P. putida (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. enteritidis (MIC 32 ug/ml), Gram+  B. subtilis (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 64 ug/ml), S.mutans (MIC 128 ug/ml), fungi C. neoformans (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. cerevisiae (MIC 32 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 32 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: MIC didn't change in the presence of 200 mM NaCL: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli; NaCl-insensitive:P. putida; NaCl-insensitive:S. enteritidis; NaCl-insensitive: B. subtilis; NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus; NaCl-insensitive:S. mutans; NaCl-insensitive:C. neoformans; NaCl-insensitive:S. cerevisiae;  NaCl-insensitive:C. albicans. Literature Information.Author: Park IY, Cho JH, Kim KS, Kim YB, Kim MS, Kim SC. 2004
Literature Information.Title: Helix stability confers salt resistance upon helical antimicrobial peptides.
